profile.title: Profile
profile.summary: Experienced Software Engineer skilled in translating code into polished and efficient digital solutions. With a meticulous attention to detail, I specialize in developing software that not only fulfills functional requirements but also results into a smooth and user-friendly experience.

areas.title: Front End
skills: SPA using <bold>React 18</bold> and <bold>yarn</bold> as the main package manager.
SSR using <bold>Next.JS 14</bold> with experience in both the new layout system and the legacy system.
Testing: Primarily using <bold>Jest</bold> for unit testing. <bold>Cypress</bold> for e2e testing
Usage of </bold>Storybook</bold> for documenting components, design systems and applications
Use of CSS-in-JS libraries such as <bold>Emotion</bold> or <bold>Styled-Components</bold>.

areas.title: Back End
skills: <bold>REST</bold> applications in node.js using <bold>express</bold> and <bold>bottle.js</bold> for dependency injection. <bold>Sequelize</bold> and <bold>mongoose</bold> for integration with different databases.

Java development experience with <bold>Spring Framework</bold> (Boot, Core, Security, MVC). Use of <bold>Hibernate</bold> for integration with Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB... Experience with Apache Tiles and JMX, integrations with <bold>Kafka</bold>.
Development of <bold>Perl</bold> applications using <bold>Catalyst</bold> as the main MVC framework.

areas.title: Mobile Apps
skills: Experience with <bold>EXPO</bold> over <bold>React Native</bold> for developing native applications.
Basic knowledge of <bold>IONIC</bold> and <bold>Cordova</bold> for web-in-app development.

areas.title: Databases
skills: Course <italic>M101J, MongoDB for Java Developers</italic> offered by MongoDB Inc. Experience with integrating MongoDB with Java, Perl, and Node.js.
Experience with Oracle, PostgreSQL (including the <bold>PostGIS</bold> module), and MySQL in Java, Perl, and Node.js.

areas.title: Others
skills: Working environment on Windows, Unix, or Mac.
Experience with <bold>Gitlab Pipelines</bold>, <bold>Github Actions</bold>, and <bold>Jenkins</bold> for CI/CD.
